intro: Grewia nodisepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled globemallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Grewia nodisepala is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
